item.title: Example Page 1
item.description:

item.title: Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Academic

Academic | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export: E

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
    print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One Two Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}
- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
{{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
  color: navy;
}

Questions?

Ask

Documentation

item.title: An example journal article
item.description:
Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.
Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.

Supplementary notes can be added here, including code and math.

item.title: 5-day running average of Cases
item.description: The 5 day running average allows for a closer look at the current rate of infection and progress in the country. The red line shows how the 5 day running average of new cases per day has changed over the 14 days leading up to 2021-02-10. We have overlaid the trend over the two weeks previous to this, shown as the dashed blue line.

item.title: Cases by Age over last 2 Weeks
item.description: Below we show the breakdown by age of the infected over the last 2 weeks. The mean cases per million for the total population is shown as the yellow dashed line, as well as the mean excluding children (where incidence may be lower) as the green dashed line. Updated as of 2021-02-10.

item.title: Cases by County last 2 Weeks
item.description: Breaking down the data to the level of cases per county over the last 2 weeks allows us to observe the current infection hotspots nationwide in a manner which is obscured when viewing the cumulative cases to date per county. Updated as of 2021-02-08.

item.title: Cases by County last 3 Weeks.
item.description:
Counties most affected

As we can see in the map, Dublin and Cavan have suffered the highest relative proportion of cases, followed by Monaghan, Westmeath, Kildare and Wicklow. As of 30-Oct , it is mainly counties of the west that have been least affected

item.title: Covid-Progression-over-Time
item.description:
Progression of the Virus

We see here the total confirmed cases in the republic, reaching 212647 on 2021-02-18. The blue bars represent the percentage increase on total while the red line tracks total cases.

item.title: Covid-related Hospitalisations
item.description:
Trend in Hospital Admissions

We see here the trend in hospitalisations on 2021-02-18. The blue bars represent the percentage increase on total while the red line tracks total hospitalisations.

item.title: Covid-related ICU Admissions
item.description:
Covid-Related ICU Admissions

We see here the total Intensive Care Unit admissions up to 2021-02-18. Total admissions currently stand at 212647 . The blue bars represent the percentage increase on total while the red line tracks total admission. (note: percentages below 0% relate to days where validation of data led to a decrease in the reported overall number of cases admitted to ICU).

item.title: Evolution-of-the-Mode-of-Transmission
item.description:
Evolution of the Mode of Transmission

As travel restricions came into place the primary mode of infection has moved away from travel to infected regions and it became far more common to catch the virus through close contact with an infected person, such as a family-member; or through Community Transmission. Updated as of 2021-02-18

Back to top

item.title: Hospitalisation by Age-Group
item.description:
Who has been hospitalised?

The red bars show the number of people hospitalised while the shade of red depicts hospitalisation status. Updated as of 2021-02-25.

```

item.title: Infection Rate By County
item.description:
Counties most affected

The representation below uses the shade of the county to show the relative number of cases present with regards to the population. The darker the shade, the greater the prevalence. Updated as of 2021-02-25.
